<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Waypoints </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Attaches a vehicle [[Object]] to the given [[Waypoint]].
<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Important </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Use this command to associate a transport with <tt>"GETIN"</tt> waypoint, other types of waypoints might work or might not. If you have different type of waypoint to start with, make it a <tt>"GETIN"</tt> type with [[setWaypointType]]</value></part></template>
</value></part><part><name>Description</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> waypoint [[waypointAttachVehicle]] vehicleName </value></part><part><name>Syntax</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> waypoint: [[Waypoint]] </value></part><part><name>Parameter 1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> vehicleName: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>Parameter 2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>Return value</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[_grp, 2] [[waypointAttachVehicle]] [[vehicle]] [[player]];</code> </value></part><part><name>Example 1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>(([[waypoints]] [[player]]) [[select]] 0) [[waypointAttachVehicle]] _soldier1;</code> </value></part><part><name>Example 2</name>=<value>

____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[waypoints]], [[deleteWaypoint]], [[copyWaypoints]], [[setCurrentWaypoint]], [[setWaypointBehaviour]], [[setWaypointCombatMode]], [[setWaypointCompletionRadius]], [[setWaypointDescription]], [[setWaypointFormation]], [[setWaypointHousePosition]], [[setWaypointPosition]], [[setWaypointScript]], [[setWaypointSpeed]], [[setWaypointStatements]], [[setWaypointTimeout]], [[setWaypointType]], [[setWaypointVisible]], [[waypointAttachedVehicle]], [[setWaypointLoiterRadius]], [[waypointLoiterRadius]], [[addWaypoint]], [[setWaypointLoiterType]], [[currentWaypoint]], [[attachObject]], [[attachTo]], [[attachedObjects]], [[attachedTo]], [[lightAttachObject]], [[triggerAttachVehicle]], [[attachedObject]] </value></part><part><name>See also</name>=<value>

</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on April 4, 2019 - 22:36 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Erentar|Erentar]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Attaches a [[Waypoint]] to the given [[vehicle]] or [[units|unit]]. Attached waypoint automatically follows the vehicle/unit it is attached to. 
</dd>
